00026 
00027 #include "kvi_settings.h"
00028 
00029 // backward compatibility
00030 #ifndef SYSTEM_SIZE_OF_SHORT_INT
00031         #define SYSTEM_SIZE_OF_SHORT_INT SIZEOF_SHORT_INT
00032         #define SYSTEM_SIZE_OF_INT SIZEOF_INT
00033         #define SYSTEM_SIZE_OF_LONG_INT SIZEOF_LONG_INT
00034         #define SYSTEM_SIZE_OF_LONG_LONG_INT SIZEOF_LONG_LONG_INT
00035 #endif 
00036 
00037 
00038 #ifdef COMPILE_ON_WINDOWS
00039         // we don't have a configure script here
00040         // so we can't check the size of types
00041         // We rely on the ms specific definitions then
00042         typedef __int64 kvi_i64_t;
00043         typedef unsigned __int64 kvi_u64_t;
00044         typedef int kvi_i32_t;
00045         typedef unsigned int kvi_u32_t;
00046         typedef short int kvi_i16_t;
00047         typedef short unsigned int kvi_u16_t;
00048         typedef char kvi_i8_t;
00049         typedef unsigned char kvi_u8_t;
00050 #else
00051         #if SYSTEM_SIZE_OF_LONG_INT == 8
00052                 // the most common case on 64 bit machines
00053                 typedef long int kvi_i64_t;
00054                 typedef unsigned long int kvi_u64_t;
00055         #elif SYSTEM_SIZE_OF_INT == 8
00056                 // 64 bit ints ?.. a Cray ? :D
00057                 typedef int kvi_i64_t;
00058                 typedef unsigned int kvi_u64_t;
00059         #elif SYSTEM_SIZE_OF_LONG_LONG_INT == 8
00060                 // the most common case on 32 bit machines
00061                 typedef long long int kvi_i64_t;
00062                 typedef unsigned long long int kvi_u64_t;
00063         #else
00064                 // attempt to live without a 64bit integer type anyway...
00065                 // dunno if it will work tough...
00066                 typedef long long int kvi_i64_t;
00067                 typedef unsigned long long int kvi_u64_t;
00068         #endif
00069 
00070         #if SYSTEM_SIZE_OF_INT == 4
00071                 // the most common case
00072                 typedef int kvi_i32_t;
00073                 typedef unsigned int kvi_u32_t;
00074         #elif SYSTEM_SIZE_OF_SHORT_INT == 4
00075                 // 32 bit shorts ?.. a Cray ? :D
00076                 typedef short int kvi_i32_t;
00077                 typedef short unsigned int kvi_u32_t;
00078         #elif SYSTEM_SIZE_OF_LONG_INT == 4
00079                 typedef long int kvi_i32_t;
00080                 typedef unsigned long int kvi_u32_t;
00081         #else
00082                 #error "Can't find a 32 bit integral type on this system"
00083                 #error "Please report to pragma at kvirc dot net"
00084         #endif
00085 
00086         #if SYSTEM_SIZE_OF_SHORT_INT == 2
00087                 // the most common case
00088                 typedef short int kvi_i16_t;
00089                 typedef short unsigned int kvi_u16_t;
00090         #elif SYSTEM_SIZE_OF_INT == 2
00091                 // this isn't going to work anyway, I think..
00092                 typedef int kvi_i16_t;
00093                 typedef long int kvi_u16_t;
00094         #else
00095                 #error "Can't find a 16 bit integral type on this system"
00096                 #error "Please report to pragma at kvirc dot net"
00097         #endif
00098 
00099         // assume that char is always 8 bit
00100         typedef char kvi_i8_t;
00101         typedef unsigned char kvi_u8_t;
00102 #endif
00103 
00104 #endif //_KVI_INTTYPES_H_
